param.name: normLevel
param.label: Normalization level
param.help: 'Core genes' option is not available for all arrays

param.name: PGFfile
param.label: .pgf indicates which probes are grouped together into a probeset*

param.name: CLFfile
param.label: .clf indicates where the probes are located in the CEL file*

param.name: CDFfile
param.label: .cdf contains both .pgf and .clf informations* (requested only if .pgf and .clf files are not available)

param.name: MPSfile
param.label: .mps defines a probeset as a collection of existing probesets* (requested for normalization at gene level)
param.help: If .mps is not selected/available a 'probeset level' normalization will be automatically performed

param.name: BGPfile
param.label: .bgp indicates which probes are to be used for computing background* (requested only if GC driven background correction is applied)
param.help: *Files should be downloaded from corresponding array specific Affymetrix webpage to insure format compatibility

param.name: annotationFile
param.label: tabular file containing available probesets annotation (requested if annotation options are selected)

param.name: keepAnnotated
param.label: Discard probe set without gene annotation

param.name: mergingMethod
param.label: Merging approach for probe set with same gene annotation

tool.help:
**What it does**
To normalize expression data from Affymetrix GeneChip arrays through Affymetrix Power Tools software.
-----
**Parameters**
\- **Title** to personalize output file names (please avoid special characters).
\- **.CEL files** you want to normalize (you can select multiple .CEL files or unique collection).
\- **Analysis to perform** : as this tool run the 'apt-probeset-summarize' command line from Affymetrix Power Tool software, this field represents the desired analysis pathway (-a parameter). Analysis pathways are summarized through predifined pathway alias with full description of all run steps below:
- gc correction + scale intensity + rma: "gc-correction,scale-intensities,rma-bg,quant-norm.sketch=0.usepm=true.bioc=true,pm-only,med-polish"
- scale intensity + rma: "scale-intensities,rma-bg,quant-norm.sketch=0.usepm=true.bioc=true,pm-only,med-polish"
- gc correction + rma: "gc-correction,rma-bg,quant-norm.sketch=0.usepm=true.bioc=true,pm-only,med-polish"
- rma: "rma-bg,quant-norm.sketch=0.usepm=true.bioc=true,pm-only,med-polish"
Please refer to `APT tool web page`__ to get more details about analysis steps.
\- **Normalization level** to choose when GeneChip array kind allows such distinction (ie. when a .mps file exists in Affymetrix webpage). 'Probe set level' is the first level where probes for same exon are merged in probe sets. 'Gene level' [recommended] is an upper level where several probe sets are merged in meta probe sets. If a meta probe set can be see as a good single gene expression indicator, several meta probe sets can still share same gene annotation.
\- **GeneChip array kind** to select array corresponding to .CEL files. Configuration files for most common Affymetrix arrays are pre-loaded, in this case you just have to select corresponding array kind. If your array is not available in this list, you should choose "other arrays" and then select manually configuration files for the array. Configuration files (.pgf, .clf, .cdf, .mps, .bgp) are available in library archive files from corresponding array Affymetrix webpage (in 'Support file' section). All these files are not mandatory for all normalizations, only .pgf and.clf files or just .cdf file are mandatory for basic normalization. .mps file is requested only for gene level normalization if it is available (see Normalization level parameter). .bgp file is requested only for analysis pathway with specific background computation. Annotation file is a simple two column tabular file, with first column containing probe set names and second corresponding annotation, it should not contains any column header.
Extract of annotation file::
TC01000020.hg.1 SAMD11 TC01000021.hg.1 KLHL17 TC01000022.hg.1 PLEKHN1 TC01000023.hg.1 ISG15 TC01000024.hg.1 AGRN
\- **Gene annotation** : add gene annotation when available (for pre-loaded arrays, most recent annotation files available from Affymetrix website are used, for other arrays, annotation files should be specified manually). You can choose to keep or discard in normalized file (meta) probe sets without match in annotation file and select merging policy for probe sets sharing same gene annotation.
-----
**Advanced parameters**
\- **Additional parameter** to give to 'apt-probeset-summarize' command line except -a, -o, -d, -p, -c, -m, -b parameters already filled by previous fields.
-----
**Outputs**
\- **tabular file** containing normalized data as tab delimited matrix. First row contains .CEL names and first column contains (meta) probe set names and/or annotated gene names::
Conditions 157_(HuGene-2_0-st).CEL 156_(HuGene-2_0-st).CEL 155_(HuGene-2_0-st).CEL 154_(HuGene-2_0-st).CEL DDX11L2 4.500872 4.429759 4.780281 4.996189 MIR1302-2 3.415065 3.520472 3.471503 3.567988 OR4F5 3.737956 3.011586 3.424494 3.497545 VWA1 5.189621 5.129595 4.806793 5.227014
\- **LOG file** containing information about execution. Useful especially if tool execution fais. Please attach this log file in any bug report.
